laboratory_examinations.findings: 101 mg/dL (5.6 mmol/L) - normal blood glucose level.
Sodium 140 mmol/L, Potassium 4.4 mmol/L, Chloride 103 mmol/L, Bicarbonate 27 mmol/L, Blood Urea Nitrogen (BUN) 44 mg/dL (16 mmol/L), Creatinine 3.1 mg/dL (274 μmol/L).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Baseline creatinine level was 1.1 mg/dL (97 μmol/L) 9 months earlier; recent changes indicate kidney injury.

laboratory_examinations.findings: BUN 47 mg/dL (17 mmol/L), Creatinine 3.6 mg/dL (318 μmol/L), 77.3% Neutrophils, 12.8% Lymphocytes, 4.9% Eosinophils, 4.4% Monocytes, 0.6% Basophils. No casts or eosinophils in urine.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased BUN and creatinine levels from previous tests.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Specific gravity 1.008, pH 7.5; no glucose or protein present, with sediment showing 10 to 15 red cells and 5 to 9 white cells per high-power field.
At discharge: Creatinine 2.6 mg/dL (230 μmol/L), Blood Urea Nitrogen 59 mg/dL (21 mmol/L).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Creatinine level down from peak 3.9 mg/dL (345 μmol/L) after treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: BUN 72 mg/dL (26 mmol/L), Creatinine 1.6 mg/dL (141 μmol/L), Hematocrit fell to 26%.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Creatinine reduced after intravenous hydration, indicating improvement.
